cast.overview: Unemployed Antonio is elated when he finally finds work hanging posters around war-torn Rome. However on his first day, his bicycle—essential to his work—gets stolen. His job is doomed unless he can find the thief. With the help of his son, Antonio combs the city, becoming desperate for justice.
cast.title: Bicycle Thieves

cast.overview: Three partisans bound by a strong friendship return home after the war, but the clash with everyday reality puts a strain on their bond.
cast.title: We All Loved Each Other So Much
cast.character: Bruno Ricci in 'Ladri di biciclette' (archive footage) (uncredited)

details.biography:
​From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia.  

Enzo Staiola (15 November 1939 - 4 June 2025) was an Italian actor best known for playing, at the age of seven, the role of Bruno Ricci, the son of protagonist Antonio Ricci in Vittorio De Sica's neorealist 1948 film Bicycle Thieves. He appeared in several other films (including the American-produced The Barefoot Contessa in 1954, which starred Humphrey Bogart) before becoming a math teacher in adulthood.

Description above from the Wikipedia article  Enzo Staiola , licensed under CC-BY-SA, full list of contributors on Wikipedia.
details.name: Enzo Staiola
